title: Week 1 — Growth & Development
topics: Physical, cognitive, psychosocial development across infancy through adolescence
Erikson, Piaget, Kohlberg developmental theories
readings: Ch. 3–7: Growth and Development of the Newborn, Infant, Toddler, Preschooler, and School-Age Child

title: Week 2 — Pain Management in Children
topics: Assessment and intervention for pediatric pain
Pharmacologic and non-pharmacologic pain control

title: Week 3 — Health Assessment of Children
topics: Comprehensive pediatric assessment
Recognizing developmental milestones and red flags

title: Week 4 — Child With Chronic Illness
topics: Family-centered care of chronically ill children
Community resources and support
readings: Ch. 17 Care of the Child With Chronic Illness

title: Week 5 — Child With Respiratory Disorder
topics: Upper and lower respiratory disorders
Asthma, croup, bronchiolitis, and pneumonia
readings: Ch. 18 Care of the Child With Respiratory Disorder

title: Week 6 — Child With Cardiovascular Disorder
topics: Congenital heart defects and acquired heart disease
Pre- and post-operative care of cardiac patients

title: Week 7 — Hematologic & Immune Disorders
topics: Anemia, hemophilia, and immune deficiencies
Safety precautions and infection prevention

title: Week 8 — Neurologic & Musculoskeletal Disorders
topics: Cerebral palsy, spina bifida, muscular dystrophy
Developmental delays and rehabilitative care

title: Week 9 — Gastrointestinal & Genitourinary Disorders
topics: Common GI and GU conditions in pediatrics
Fluid and electrolyte imbalances

title: Week 10 — Endocrine & Metabolic Disorders
topics: Diabetes mellitus and congenital metabolic conditions
Growth hormone deficiency and thyroid issues

title: Week 11 — Integumentary & Communicable Diseases
topics: Pediatric skin conditions, rashes, and infectious diseases
Isolation precautions and family education
readings: Ch. 27 and 28 Integumentary and Communicable Diseases

title: Week 12 — Pediatric Emergencies & Final Review
topics: Emergency care and resuscitation of children
Family support during crisis situations
Course review and final exam preparation
